byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Cihuatlán, and Paulina Villegas from Barra de Navidad, Mexico. Reporting was contributed by Laura Tillman from Manzanillo, Mexico; Elisabeth Malkin and William Neuman from Mexico City; and Frances Robles from Miami.
byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PAULINA VILLEGAS

abstract: Residents of Mexico in areas hard hit by Hurricane Patricia begin returning to work and life, expressing feelings of gratitude that storm caused no fatalities; most say while considerable physical damage caused by storm will take significant amount of time and work to repair, it is work they are happy to face after fearing they might not live through the storm.
lead_paragraph: President Enrique Peña Nieto said there were no initial reports of deaths but the danger was not past. “We still can’t lower our guard,” he said.

headline.main: Mexico Spared Major Damage by Giant Storm
headline.print_headline: Mexico Exhales After Surviving a Giant Storm

snippet: President Enrique Peña Nieto said there were no initial reports of deaths but the danger was not past. “We still can’t lower our guard,” he said.
